name: Easy Pork Chops with Cream of Mushroom Soup
author: Becky Lemcke Thompson
summary: We love this pork chop recipe.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed
1 (10.75 ounce) can  cream of mushroom soup
½ (6 ounce) can french-fried onions, divided
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix together flour, salt, and pepper in a rimmed plate
Dredge pork chops in flour mixture; shake off excess
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add pork chops and cook, turning halfway, until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side
Place chops in an 11x17-inch baking dish
Stir canned soup and water together in a small bowl until well blended
Pour over pork chops and sprinkle with 1/2 of the fried onions
Cover and bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, about 50 minutes
Stir in sour cream and top with remaining onions
Return to the oven and bake, uncovered, until sauce is hot, about 10 minutes more
